Name: Peer support services for veterans.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to peer support services for veterans

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders

History.Description: This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Veterans’ Services (DVS) to coordinate with veteran service organizations to establish a hotline to provide peer support services and information to veterans.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Title 31 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 31-111 to read as follows:
      � 31-111 Peer support services. a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the term "veteran peer specialist" shall mean an individual who is a veteran and is certified as a peer specialist in New York State. 
      b. The department shall coordinate with veteran service organizations for the purpose of establishing a hotline to provide peer support services and information to veterans. Such hotline shall be staffed by veteran peer specialists and shall provide counseling and referral services for callers.     
      c. The department shall post on its website the peer support hotline telephone number, telephone operating hours and any additional information deemed by the department to be relevant.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law.


BBB/KET / BM/BV
Int. 324-2014 / LS 1392 / Int. 503-2011/Int. 0647-2018
